Text.Value: Examine him for signs of Laduguer's Bite.
Oh, you'll figure it out. You owe me a debt, and I intend to collect.
I removed the petrification spell.
The hag is dead.
You're sick? Are you contagious?
Argh. The stones take you, you disgusting half-breed. I'll deal with this myself.
Sorry - now ain't the time for blathering.

EditorData.NodeContext: Trying to pull yourself together after getting emotional - unusual for you.

Text.Value: Oh, no. No. No. NO.

EditorData.NodeContext: Panic ramps up, tinted by rage. You're about to die and you know it.

Text.Value: How... how am I still breathin'?

EditorData.NodeContext: Confused as you look down at your hands and body - feeling fine. You're trying to make sense of everything.

Text.Value: You struck a deal with the hag, didn't you?
That double-crossing, filthy, lying wretch.

EditorData.NodeContext: Spitting the words - you're furious.

Text.Value: My kids were only babes when I left. The stones know how old they are now.

EditorData.NodeContext: Ibid.

Text.Value: How long were you trapped like this?
Ungh... what... argh... what in the bloody hells is going on?

EditorData.AnimationTags: Murat - Coming out from stone (was petrified).
EditorData.NodeContext: You were turned to stone and you're just coming out of it. Dazed, confused, touching your head.
EditorData.VFXTags: FX_Special - Coming out from stone (was petrified).

Text.Value: I'll find another way. I swear to you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Stern but kind - you're determined to pay the player back -one day

Text.Value: You won't be left wanting. You've my word.

EditorData.NodeContext: Stern but kind - you're determined to pay the player back -one day

Text.Value: Examine him for signs of magic.
True. And I don't plan to waste a moment more.

EditorData.NodeContext: Determined - you're gonna find your kids and fast.

Text.Value: Damn it. You could've said as much from the start.
But why... bloody hells.

EditorData.NodeContext: Dawning realisation that the hag did this to you in the first place. Mounting horror.

Text.Value: You do?
Ha! The Bite should have turned you inside out by now.
*As far as you can tell, he's in perfectly good health.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The player close his eyes and raise a hand to the character
EditorData.VFXTags: FX_Special - (Murat) - One hand raised, the player examinate the character for any signs of disease.

Text.Value: I wouldn't wish it on anyone. Yer insides... end up on the outside. Petrification stops the spread.

EditorData.NodeContext: Wincing as you described the horrific disease. Think the Black Plague.

Text.Value: Look, greyling or not, you having a look put my mind at ease.
And that the Bite... Laduguer's Bite was fatal.

EditorData.NodeContext: Confused as you look down at your hands and body - feeling fine.

Text.Value: Look for remnants of the hag's magic.
No time for questions. Get out of here while you still can.
The very one. Complete with everything from sores to vomitin' blood. By the time it kills you it - wait.

EditorData.NodeContext: You have an incurable disease and the player has basically condemned you to death. You start to freak out as you realise the implication - the player hasn't cured you.

Text.Value: Laugh harder.
I've heard tales of Laduguer's Bite. Don't your insides end up on your outside?
Listen, I have places to be.
But now you have many more years ahead of you.
She made me sick. And then trapped me in stone for kicks.

EditorData.NodeContext: This is shocking realisation - you nearly died because you trusted the hag.

Text.Value: I'm almost impressed - that's evil, even by a hag's standards.
Are you sick or something?
She petrified me to stop it from spreading until - oh no.

EditorData.NodeContext: You realise the player didn't cure you. They've condemned you to death. Panic rising. Frightened.

Text.Value: Because I saved you. You're welcome.
How?

EditorData.NodeContext: Ibid.

Text.Value: The duergar, of course. Filthy greylings.

EditorData.NodeContext: Spitting the word. These are your enemies and you were dying because of them.

Text.Value: You did what? But - but you can't!

EditorData.NodeContext: Player has removed a spell that prevented you from dying. Panic and rage as you try to explain.

Text.Value: Ungh... me head...

EditorData.AnimationTags: Murat - Coming out from stone (was petrified).
EditorData.NodeContext: You were turned to stone and you're just coming out of it. Dazed, confused, touching your head.
EditorData.VFXTags: FX_Special - Coming out from stone (was petrified).
EditorData.logicalname: Hag is dead but wasn't summoned

Text.Value: The Bite's a terrible disease. I can see why you went to the hag.
What's 'the Bite'?
What? But that would mean...

EditorData.NodeContext: Dawning realisation that the hag did this to you in the first place. Mounting horror.

Text.Value: I - I have the Bite. Laduguer's Bite.

EditorData.NodeContext: You have an incurable disease - admitting it with worry and shame.

Text.Value: Grateful? I've got Laduguer's Bite! I'm dying! Why else do you think I was petrified?

EditorData.NodeContext: You have an incurable disease and the player has basically condemned you to death. You start to freak out as you realise the implications.

Text.Value: I - I don't know. Days? Years?

EditorData.NodeContext: The reality of your situation is dawning on you - you may have missed out on the entirety of your children's lives - for nothing.

Text.Value: I'm getting out of this hellhole. You'd best do the same.

EditorData.NodeContext: You're alive but that could change at any moment. Nearly running out the door.

Text.Value: I'm here to help.
You don't sound pleased. Would you rather be a statue?
I was on death's door when the hag cast... wait. You didn't - you didn't cure the Bite?

EditorData.NodeContext: Panic ramps up, tinted by rage. Turn the accusations on the player.

Text.Value: How did you cure it? The Bite?

EditorData.NodeContext: You have an incurable disease and you can't believe they player managed to fix it (spoiler: they didn't)

Text.Value: I'm sorry this happened to you.
Ungh... what... argh... what happened?

EditorData.AnimationTags: Murat - Coming out from stone (was petrified).
EditorData.NodeContext: You were turned to stone and you're just coming out of it. Dazed, confused, touching your head.
EditorData.VFXTags: FX_Special - Coming out from stone (was petrified).

Text.Value: In the tales, hags always cook up their victim's misery first, then sell them false hope.
Mordenkainen warns us that hags often cause their victims' tragedies.
What?! How... how am I still breathin'?

EditorData.NodeContext: Player has said the hag is dead - which means so should you. You're shocked.

Text.Value: That double-crossing, filthy, lying hag.

EditorData.NodeContext: Spitting the words - you're furious.

Text.Value: Could you have a look... please.
Attune with your blood and search him for magic.
Help? You bloody Duergar gave me the Bite! But... the way I feel...

EditorData.NodeContext: Player has said they're here to help. You're relived and still putting the piece together. Grateful and happy.

Text.Value: I don't want to die, I - *retch*

EditorData.AnimationTags: Murat - Clutches stomach as you lean over and vomit before collapsing on the ground, dead in your own vomit and blood.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: |Cinematic - clutches stomach as he vomits. He collapses on the ground - dead. in a pool of his own blood and vomit.
EditorData.NodeContext: Crying, freaking out, leaning over and vomiting horribly as they collapse on the ground.
EditorData.VFXTags: FX_Special - (Murat) - The character vomits and die in a pool of his own blood and vomit.

Text.Value: What's 'the Bite' exactly?
You're in a hag's lair.
Don't worry. I didn't help just to get a reward.
I - I remember that bit. I think. She...  turned me to stone. Because of the Bite! Of course.

EditorData.NodeContext: Your memories are coming back. You remember going to the hag for a spell to save you.

Text.Value: No.
Oh, no, no. Why - why did you remove the spell if ya couldn't fix me?!

EditorData.NodeContext: Panic ramps up, tinted by rage. You realise the player hasn't cured you of a horrible and contagious disease you have - they've condemned you to death.

Text.Value: Oh no. No. Why ain't I petrified?

EditorData.NodeContext: Panic as you realise the petrification - the thing keeping a deadly disease from spreading across your body - is gone.

Text.Value: Yer right. And look... thank you. I don't know how you pulled it off - but thank you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Gratitude - you are only alive because of the player.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The character is alive and not petrified.

Text.Value: Why would you turn me back if you didn't -

EditorData.NodeContext: Panic ramps up, tinted by rage. Turn the accusations on the player.

Text.Value: Heh. I thought the same, 'til I held me own in my arms.

EditorData.NodeContext: Player has said children are gross. A knowing smile as you think of your own. Love in your voice.

Text.Value: *You can't detect anything. You have no explanation for his good health.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The player close his eyes and raise a hand to the character
EditorData.VFXTags: FX_Special - (Murat) - One hand raised, the player examinate the character for any signs of disease.

Text.Value: Why d'ya think I came to the hag? It was get petrified... or end up covered in me own insides.

EditorData.NodeContext: Said sadly - it was a difficult choice and one you struggled with. You're speaking to someone who knows of the disease.

Text.Value: I can feel the hag's magic on you - it tastes of sickness.
Hmm? What was that?
The hag is gone.
You didn't fix it? Oh no.

EditorData.NodeContext: Panic ramps up, tinted by rage. Turn the accusations on the player as they realise they haven't

Text.Value: Because nothing disgusts us more than you lot.
Evil don't begin to cover it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Bitter and dejected.

Text.Value: What? Are you sayin' it wasn't the Bite? But... bloody hells.

EditorData.NodeContext: Dawning realisation that the hag did this to you in the first place. Mounting horror.

Text.Value: Laduguer's Bite? How'd you catch it?

EditorData.AnimationTags: Stepping back, scared of the disease.

Text.Value: The stones know how old they are now.

EditorData.NodeContext: Ibid.

Text.Value: Right? It was that or die covered in me own insides. It's why she petrified me - to stop the spread.

EditorData.NodeContext: You're speaking to someone who knows of the disease.

Text.Value: What? But that doesn't make a lick of sense. Unless...

EditorData.NodeContext: Dawning realisation that the hag did this to you in the first place. Mounting horror.

Text.Value: I've the bloody Bite! Laduguer's Bite! The petrification stopped it spreading...

EditorData.NodeContext: You have an incurable disease and the player has basically condemned you to death. You start to freak out as you realise the implications.

Text.Value: Hopefully they've grown. Children are disgusting.
I s'pose I should count my blessings. Most ain't so lucky.

EditorData.NodeContext: Player can't figure out why you're fine now. You don't want to look at it too closely. Grateful to be alive.

Text.Value: *You detect traces of decaying magic within him. Likely the cause of his disease.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DUPE] Murat - The player close his eyes and raise a hand to the character
EditorData.VFXTags: FX_Special - (Murat) - One hand raised, the player examinate the character for any signs of disease.

Text.Value: Why d'ya think I'm here? The hag petrified me. Only way to stop it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Said sadly - it was a difficult choice and one you struggled with.

Text.Value: Not enough to hang around here, mind, but... thank you. And best of luck.
Ain't nothin' like it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Ibid.

Text.Value: We 'greylings' know the Bite well - ask nicely, and I'll see how long you've got left.
I... only wish I could do more to repay you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Usually a gruff man, it is difficult for you to truly express how thankful and grateful you are - but you're trying.

Text.Value: Tell you what, you ever come by my way? You've a seat at my dinner table.

EditorData.NodeContext: Friendly and warm. You feel for the player.

Text.Value: Gods, no - Argh. Help.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Choking a little - gripping his stomach. Reaching forward with one hand - as if to grab the player.
EditorData.NodeContext: Chokes a little - as if about to vomit. You're dying. Panic and fear ramped up to the max.

Text.Value: *Not only is the disease gone, you see it's left no scars - an impossibility for the Bite.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: Murat - The player close his eyes and raise a hand to the character
EditorData.VFXTags: FX_Special - (Murat) - One hand raised, the player examinate the character for any signs of disease.

Text.Value: Isn't Laduguer's Bite terminal?
I've the Bite...

EditorData.NodeContext: Confused as you look down at your hands and body - feeling fine. You're trying to make sense of everything.

Text.Value: I left me wife, me kids behind, for fear of infecting them. They were only babes.

EditorData.NodeContext: The reality of your situation is dawning on you - you may have missed out on the entirety of your children's lives - for nothing.

Text.Value: But - but how? The hag said there was no cure.

EditorData.NodeContext: You should be dead. You have an incurable disease. You're trying to make sense of everything.

Text.Value: What kind of fool would make a pact with a hag?
Search for any sign of Laduguer's Bite.
Focus on the positive. At least now you'll see them again.
I can't believe you fixed it. How did you cure me?

EditorData.NodeContext: . You have an incurable disease and you can't believe they player managed to fix it (spoiler: they didn't)

Text.Value: I had no bloody choice! I'm dying!

EditorData.NodeContext: The player has been condescending to you. You went to a hag to save your life. Angry and embarassed.

Text.Value: You... want to be petrified?
I... could you have a look?
I'll get to see them again, hold 'em again, 'cause of you. I - I ain't got not way to repay you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Usually a gruff man, it is difficult for you to truly express how thankful and grateful you are - but you're trying.

Text.Value: Well - yes. Why d'ya bloody think I'm here?

EditorData.NodeContext: Player has asked about your disease and was it contagious. You're surprised and confused by the question.

Text.Value: Gods, r-really? I thought I was dead. I was sure...  thank you. Thank you so much.

EditorData.NodeContext: Player has said they're here to help. You're relived and still putting the piece together. Grateful and happy.

Text.Value: You should be grateful. I expect payment.
Only 'cause of you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Usually a gruff man, it is difficult for you to truly express how thankful and grateful you are - but you're trying.

Text.Value: Thank you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Voice thick with emotion as you think of your family - and that you'll see them again soon.

Text.Value: I don't fancy hangin' around here. But... thank you. And best of luck.

EditorData.NodeContext: Gratitude - you are only alive because of the player.

Text.Value: I... I ain't got no way to repay you.
No - what you've done for me and mine today won't be forgotten.

EditorData.NodeContext: Stern but kind - you're determined to pay the player back -one day

Text.Value: 'Cause they're family. Why else?

EditorData.NodeContext: Surprised at the player's reaction - you wonder if they've ever had a family to call their own.

Text.Value: I was on death's door. But now I feel... I feel great.

EditorData.NodeContext: You're grateful tp be alive but also completely confused.

Text.Value: I had to. I was sick. Real sick. The hag petrified me - to stop it spreading.

EditorData.NodeContext: Said sadly - it was a difficult choice and one you struggled with.

Text.Value: I fixed your petrification - nothing else.
Better dead than a greyling. Why d'ya think we call it Laduguer's Bite? After that slaver of a god you adore?
Why would you wish to meet your spawn?
Changed my mind. Enjoy tripping over your own guts.
Examine him for signs of Laduguer's Bite.
Laduguer's  Bite? I caught it when - wait. You didn't... you didn't fix it?

EditorData.NodeContext: You have an incurable disease and the player has basically condemned you to death. You start to freak out as you realise the implications.

Text.Value: But that doesn't make a lick of sense. The Bite ain't magical. Unless...

Synopsis:
The dwarf was turned to stone by the hag to stop the spread of an deadly disease - Laduguer's Bite. Little does he know that the hag was the one who cause the disease in the first place.

Should you remove the petrification spell BEFORE the hag is dead, the disease will kill him.

Should you speak to him after the hag is dead, you can figure out that the hag is the one who made him sick in the first place.
